website_summaries.verdict: High-quality folding bike tire by Continental that is ideal for road biking and will last a long time.
pros: Highly resistant to any foreign body without reducing the rolling resistance
Lightweight and comfortable to ride on the road
cons: Traction is not ideal in wet conditions

customer_reviews.title: Get these; they're good
customer_reviews.text: My flat tires were frequent until the guy at my local bike shop up-sold me on a Gatorskin. Then my problem with flats disappeared—on that wheel anyway. The next time the other wheel got yet another flat (a week later), I just put a Gatorskin on that wheel too. No flats since then. I had tried a few different tires from a few different brands (even some kevlar varieties), but nothing has held up like these Gatorskin Hardshells. I plan on only riding on these tires from now on. No more random, undependable cheapies for me.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Extremely tough and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is my third set of the Gators. They are extremely durable and over a few thousand miles I’ve had 4 or 5 flats across all three sets. The primary con is they are difficult to mount on the rims. I had to muscle both on whereas standard tires take less than 10 minutes to swap out in total.
customer_reviews.author: Mike O

customer_reviews.title: better than the rando for brakeless fixed city bikes
customer_reviews.text: i've been riding a brakeless track bike in the city for over 15 years and this tire has the best skidding lifespan out there; yes, it lasts longer than the vittoria randonneur, and because it's a proper road tire it also has less rolling resistance so it's faster. the price point on the non-folding bead is so comparable that this is the easy decision; i've completely changed over to this tire.
customer_reviews.author: blair cerny

customer_reviews.title: Great for the city!
customer_reviews.text: Riding it for about a month in Los Angeles where there's shards of glass everywhere and I havent had any flats so far! Just a reminder make sure your tire is facing the correct direction. There are arrows on the sidewall that point towards a direction.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Best Tire out there for urban rider.
customer_reviews.text: Best Tire out there for urban rider. I ride a fixie in Boston MA. I get about 2800 miles per year and endure some pretty brutal condition and roads. These are (mostly) bomb proof. Eventually they succumb to the city but I never second guess them. Worth the extra $. and Much cheaper than in store. NOTE: I ride Velocity Deep V rims and these are a perfect fit. But, they are such tough tires that they can be really hard to put on/take off the rims. Expect to work for it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Krikava

customer_reviews.title: Great commute tires
customer_reviews.text: I bike commute on a route where there's often glass and other tire killers on the road. I've tried other tires recommended by the local bike shop, but nothing I've used holds up like the Gators.
customer_reviews.author: Charles MacC

customer_reviews.title: not for racing so I still think it's a great tire. Good thing it doesn't flat much because ...
customer_reviews.text: This tire is extremely durable, cut-resistant and puncture-resistant. I would have rated it 5 stars, but the rolling resistance is fairly high. I rode it on a century ride last weekend and noticed a big difference in how well it rolled compared to my Michelin Krylion tires that I took off. Still, you buy this tire for durability and flat resistance, not for racing so I still think it's a great tire. Good thing it doesn't flat much because getting it on and off the rim is nearly impossible.
customer_reviews.author: KKapp

customer_reviews.title: If you want no flats, then spend the money on this tire.
customer_reviews.text: Flats can virtually ruin your entire ride. I have put literally 800 miles on the same 2 GATOR HARDSHELL (700x25) and have not yet had 1 single flat. I weigh about 167lbs, and before EVERY single ride I pump these x25's up to 105. Perhaps I've had good luck, perhaps the air pressure is perfect... PERHAPS this is an amazing tire that deserves your order. It is an OUTSTANDING tire. and it offers more protection than the GATORSKIN.
customer_reviews.author: mtbiker89

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Once again Amazon description is wrong. Description states 'Continental Gator Hardshell Folding Bike Tire' but what was shipped was a steel wire beaded tire which cannot be folded without damaging the bead. NOT a folding tire. I've gotten to where I expect what I order to not match what was described.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after getting a flat while biking to work. I live in a city and I ran over broken glass. Being lazy, I tried these out. I've been using these tires for almost a year without a problem- I bike to work everyday and it's holding up well in the early winter weather. Plus the bike lanes in my city are crappy- poorly paved and full of debris. They also survived perfectly fine when I was hit by a car, which may be more of a testament to my bike frame but I'm still very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: empenn

customer_reviews.title: Best bike tires I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best bike tires I've ever had. I live in New Orleans and the roads here are a scene from a craggy hellscape. I thought LA was bad, little did I realize that there was a city in America with roads like this: constant road construction, rocks everywhere, and deep potholes that people fill with beads. These tires are a lifesaver and I haven't gotten a single flat since I've had them. Well worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Have had these only a few weeks, and several hundred miles. So far no flats! With the "goat head" stickers we have here in So Colorado that is kinda a big deal, I have had many a ride ruined by them. Low rolling resistance and seem to corner well. I haven't had an opportunity to try them out under wet conditions. These are a bit on the heavy side. So if you are a stickler for shaving grams off, you may want to look elsewhere. Haven't had them long enough to call them bullet proof but I'm liking these so far.
customer_reviews.author: T_B_C

customer_reviews.title: An excellent tire.
customer_reviews.text: Im guessing these are the last tires I will ever need. Well, Not really. I use my bike a lot. But these have stayed fresh and sturdy for a much longer time than other tires I have had. I ride a lot in wet weather, and although I don't know a ton about bike tires, these do a great job of gripping the wet pavement! I will definitely buy again when I desperately need to.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Birch

customer_reviews.title: Tough, pretty flexible but they STINK!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these a few years back, wore them out and finally got these new ones. Got them quick, no problem but was about put to tears from the stench after opening the box - they really stink! It was like walking into a Harbor Freight store will all the Chinese rubber wheels and such. No problem with the tires, just have to get them dirty fast to knock down the funk!
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: No more flats
customer_reviews.text: I commute daily and after moving to the Bay Area, was getting a flat at least once a week because of the thorns here. After having these for a month (with thorn resistant tubes), no more flats. They're slightly heavier than the Kenda tires they replaced, but seem to have less rolling resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Street

customer_reviews.title: The tires are great!
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is how hard they are to put on. I'm assuming the stiffness and thickness of the tire make it much better in protection against flats, but this is probably the hardest tire to get on that I've ever experienced. So hopefully I'll not have to be changing a tube real soon. I'm told that over time as it relaxes a little it becomes more pliable. Hope so. But overall feel very comfortable with the ride and feel confident in the protection factor of the tire.
customer_reviews.author: V. Walters

customer_reviews.title: The Most Durable Tire Ever.  Period.
customer_reviews.text: I have come to rely on the Gatorskins and Gator Hardshells for all my bicycling, having gone through an entire season of urban bicycle commuting with zero flats. I am convinced that when armageddon strikes, the only thing left will be the cockroaches and Gatorskins.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dura Skins
customer_reviews.text: These with a German stamp manufacturer have been some of the best buys I have ridden with. In 1500 miles only one glass flat and perfect combination of a tire that wears long, resists flats and is not too heavy. I will buy them not only for training but put a new set on a week before races to get them tuned in and set.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Burki

customer_reviews.title: well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend these tires enough. I went from getting 1 flat a week to none since I put these on. They were a bit of a pain to get on and I switched to a thicker tube too, but again, 10 minutes of annoyance is well worth not changing a tire on the side of the road...
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great tires. I have enjoyed not getting a flat and have had them on my bike for the last 150 miles. They feel very thick but I do not notice that they are slowing me down.
customer_reviews.author: LBZ mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Tires!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these tires for over a year and have no complaints. I have had very few flats compared to others in my cycling group. I ride on the riverbed near my home which is usually strewn with glass. Great tires!
customer_reviews.author: EBRUIN22

customer_reviews.title: Great tire and hard to pop!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife who kept getting flat tires. She's had these for 5 months and hasn't gotten one flat. They are difficult to put on the wheel, but you won't have to change tubes nearly as often with these.
customer_reviews.author: eltorre

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was having many issues with my former Continental Ultrasports getting flats. They may have just had too many miles on them to expect anything better. Since I've changed to the Gator Hardshells I have had no flats (about 1000 miles so far). The ride is good on dry pavement (haven't ridden in wet yet). I read in the reviews some had issues with fitting the tires on the rims. I had no such troubles with my DT Swiss rims. The new tires were firm and required a tool to install the last bit of the way, but I installed them most of the way by hand. I'd purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: thefishdoc

customer_reviews.title: great tire
customer_reviews.text: I have used continental duraskins on my bicycle and the wifes bicycle for several years. They wear great and I have never had a flat, and my wife has had only one. She has biked from coast to coast on them.
customer_reviews.author: DR. BOB

customer_reviews.title: These tires were made for rolling and rolling in all conditions
customer_reviews.text: I often ride 200-250 miles a weekend in the summer and both for flat protection and longevity these tires are the very best. If I was racing, I might go with a softer tire with better traction but that's a different ride.
customer_reviews.author: Timsamazonhome

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the aggressive rider
customer_reviews.text: My go-to tubes for crazy NYC riding! Perfect for the aggressive rider. Oh, and if you hate flats, like myself :)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A. Mata

customer_reviews.title: I love not getting flats
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy riding so much more now that I don't have to change out a tube every other week. Yes, the tires are heavier than the stock tires on most road bikes, but unless you're racing, then you probably won't notice the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Tom A.

customer_reviews.title: No flats in over a month
customer_reviews.text: I am one of those bike riders that seems to get a flat just thinking about one. So I spent the money and bought these hardshells. I am glad I did, no flats despite riding over sharp rocks from construction and broken glass all up and down the street. I have owned armadillo tires in the past and these beat them. For the avid bike rider you will find them a little slow due to the hard shell but when weighing flats against a little bumbier and slower ride I will take having no flats all the time. These tires have been proven superior. I am using them in conjunction with Sunlite thorn-resistant bicycle tubes.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Cardell

customer_reviews.title: Great tire
customer_reviews.text: A little more difficult to install but a great tire. Ride has been no different and no flats
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Helps prevent flats in bike lanes that are filled with junk. Roads need to be cleaned off, but until then I have these tires.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Watkins

customer_reviews.title: This tire is very durable
customer_reviews.text: I needed new tires for my bike. After reading several reviews on different tires I settled on purchasing this tire, I'm not disappointed. The tire is very durable and rolls with little resistance.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. S.

customer_reviews.title: Hope I just got a bad one and it's not a regular problem
customer_reviews.text: Was happy until under high breaking it heated up and blew off the rim scary as all get out
customer_reviews.author: Paul Correia

customer_reviews.title: Best Tires for daily biking.
customer_reviews.text: These tires are tough and can handle the hot streets of Phoenix, they are a good looking and long lasting tire that will take a day to day pounding. I Like them and know you will too.
customer_reviews.author: Tattoo Mark

customer_reviews.title: Top puncture resistance and rolls great
customer_reviews.text: Tire is designed to avoid punctures and given the way it is built, it will do that much better than other tires. It is harder to put on. I am surprised that appears to roll much better than most other tires.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: really strong tire
customer_reviews.text: tire was really strong, even skidding on the tire for months it is still in good condition
customer_reviews.author: Chun Chen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best training tired around. (Not for racing or diving into corners if they is your style on fun rides.)
customer_reviews.author: SoonerInAustin

customer_reviews.title: Bullet Proof
customer_reviews.text: I have used the gator skins and hard shells for years. Great winter tire to help fight all the a#d& on the roads. When you hit a twig or branch, you can just keep on going. Well worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Great tire!
customer_reviews.text: Great tire!!! People complain that they are heavy. Just get stronger and it won't matter. A few extra grams is still faster than a punctured tube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Nice tires but heavy. But what is a little extra weight when you are getting into shape? No problems on the chipseal.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good Trainer
customer_reviews.text: I had a bad start with this tire, but since then, it has performed very well as a durable trainer. The tire has been running smooth without problems. I have upped the rating and I bought another. Third edit: Just bought my 3rd one. If you get good tube placement in this tire, it will last hundreds of miles on rough roads. Upped the rating to max. This tire is a road warrior!
customer_reviews.author: Speed-Racer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install but working well once on
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to get on the wheelset (Bontrager Race) but they are wearing well and have had no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: DaveReadsALot

customer_reviews.title: Rides like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Rides like a champ. Good thing I had this on the shelf as had a cut tire and didn't miss a day of riding.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: This should be your go to tire.
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended these tires and man was he right. Light weight and hella durable. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Good but tough to put on
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be very solid...accordingly they were very difficult to get on.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Kent

customer_reviews.title: Solid tire
customer_reviews.text: Solid tire, pretty easy to install with just plastic tire irons. Got a couple hundred miles on them. Feel just fine for me
customer_reviews.author: Adam Brown

customer_reviews.title: Tough.
customer_reviews.text: These lasted a whole month with frequent skids in NYC as a messenger 10 hours per day... Four more words required...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Tiskevics

customer_reviews.title: These tires are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: You can really feel the extra tread put into these tires to stop thorns. They also have superior air pressure intake than my stock tires which only took 110psi max. If u have a problem with thorns like i did i suggest u get these tires and liners to be sure. I personaly hv these tires, liners, and i slimed my tires. You can slime presta valve tubes, just look it up on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I was getting very tired of replacing/fixing tubes so I purchased these based on reviews stating their durability. They probably are a little slow due to their weight, and were difficult to install, but I am very satisfied with them so far (only 200 miles). Same roads but no flats!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J Thaine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price and quality. If you don't want a flat buy these from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome durable and saved me from a lot of flats
customer_reviews.text: I have had two new bikes. A Specialized and a Trek. Within a few rides on the stock tires I had several flats. Put these on, no flats. Great value and worth the money to avoid the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Philip J. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME URBAN TRAINING TIRE!
customer_reviews.text: I live in metro Orlando and put in 150-300 miles / week. This spring, as the miles climbed, so did the flats, about 1 per week on Bontrager and Continental "Lite" clinchers. I've had these puppies on for 2 months now with no flats, including a Tour de Cure century. Heavy as poo- but worth the weight in gold as I don't miss changing out flats in skin tight Lycra as tourists speed by!
customer_reviews.author: J. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: I love these tires
customer_reviews.text: I love these tires. I little on the pricey side but no flats which equals more time in the saddle.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Well satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a spare as I have over 3200 miles on the previous one with no flats or problems. Well satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Birch

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these tires on my bike for over a year now. Not a single flat!!!! Love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: lvd1111

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've been riding on Continental tires for 4 years. 15,000 + miles. Won't ride anything else.
customer_reviews.author: JeffJAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hardshells for the hard rider
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to be riding on the tough streets of Baltimore like I do, then you should have a tire as tough as if not tougher than the streets, gator hardshells are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Alex the bike guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff. I'll try to keep this review updated ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had these tires for just a few weeks and I am totally impressed. I've driven through glass, construction sites ect.. Ive become very confident that these tires will not fail me. They are truly gaining my trust. Awesome stuff. I'll try to keep this review updated in the future..
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL ROYALTY

customer_reviews.title: Very solid tire
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I was worried about ordering my tires online but they were exactly as described, these are the solid rim style not the foldable kind and I was pleasantly surprised how easy they went on my rims, the ride quality was very smooth which I wasn't expecting, I use Thorn proof tubes with tire liners as I don't like having to change tubes if I don't have to, I would recommend these to anyone looking to upgrade your tires
customer_reviews.author: GDavidson

customer_reviews.title: I still get flat tires like usual. Not worth the
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tires because i keep getting a flat tire due to plant torns. This product is really hard shell as described. I still get flat tires like usual. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Tough tire
customer_reviews.text: Pretty new but so far so good. Is of course a little heavy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best.
customer_reviews.text: I'm curious about there being a better tire.I still don't think any tire this size could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Hisself77009

customer_reviews.title: If you ride in goathead country like El Paso you can't wrong
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these in April and now have 5000 plus miles on my new bike with only 4 flats. The wire bead does make mounting a challenge and they do roll a bit harder. If you ride in goathead country like El Paso you can't wrong!
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Nice tires! Be careful when installing
customer_reviews.text: Nice tires! Be careful when installing, one little pinch in my tube caused me to have a flat on the first ride, my fault though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... are not the fastest tires but they work absolutely fine as training ones
customer_reviews.text: They are not the fastest tires but they work absolutely fine as training ones. If you ride your bike for commuting, but also for serious training on rough roads this is definitely a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Fortunato Ferrara

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tire
customer_reviews.text: Great tire already have 1400 miles and no flats. Looking forward to many more months of carefree biking. Super tire
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: great tire
customer_reviews.text: If you don't want a flat and still want a relatively competitive tire this is the one. I get more miles per set than anything I have ever run.
customer_reviews.author: peter j

customer_reviews.title: Great Tores
customer_reviews.text: Glass and Goatheads haven't been an issue with these on. I would also give them credit for lasting longer than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dirksen

customer_reviews.title: Nice tires!!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Only have about 100 miles on them. The tires provide a much smoother ride than I expected. Primarily use them as a training tire.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The grip with these are insane and I feel like they will last longer than my car tires.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob W.

customer_reviews.title: I had Gatorskins that I wore down till the core ...
customer_reviews.text: I had Gatorskins that I wore down till the core was showing without ever having a flat. These are the only tires I want to use now.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: a great tire at a great price
customer_reviews.text: The deal from start to finish was very smooth. I will recommend this purchase to my friends as I will buy from this site again
customer_reviews.author: david Breaux

customer_reviews.title: No flats!
customer_reviews.text: I put well over a thousand miles on these tires in the last year without a single flat. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Danny Olewine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great tire. couple hundred miles and looks like its in a great shape. Little wear.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Chavez JR

customer_reviews.title: not as described
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon description for this tire is that it is a folding tire. What was delivered is a wire bead tire. I have ridden Gator Skins for years and thought I would try the hardshell. The 3 stars rating is NOT because of the quality of the tire which is a 5 star but the poor description.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: Great tires
customer_reviews.text: The tires were really great quality and the packaging was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Vega

customer_reviews.title: great tire
customer_reviews.text: these tires are great. better than the 23cm because you get a little more grip. great for fix riders. sweet
customer_reviews.author: Diego Gerena-quinones

customer_reviews.title: Improper Shipping Can Damage
customer_reviews.text: I have used these tires for years and they are great. However, the last pair I ordered from Amazon came in a box too small, and so the tires were creased. Well, I was looking at my front tire on my bike and noticed an indentation on one side and a big bulge on the other. The sides of the tire were apparently damaged by shipping them in the small box.
customer_reviews.author: Loon Watcher

product_meta.title: Continental Gator Hardshell Road Tire
product_meta.description:
If you're seeking an all-season bike tire to conquer your local training grounds, look to the tire that Continental nicknamed The Super Gator. DuraSkin anti-cut fabric protects the Gator Hardshell from bead to bead, wrapping further into the sidewall to protect from side attacks. An extra-wide Poly-X Breaker covers the entire tread strip, adding another degree of puncture resistance and increasing tire life -- all without the added weight of other all-season tires.

 * Lightweight Continental DuraSkin protects from cuts, punctures and abrasions 
 * Poly-X Breaker lays tightly overlapped fibers of polyester to add resistance to thorns or shards without increasing rolling resistance 
 * "Reflex" reflective sidewall increases visibility at night 
 * Tread pattern deflects debris, reducing the risk of collecting it on the tire
feature_bullets: PERFECTLY BALANCED- The Gatorskin has set the bar for a perfectly balanced blend of ride quality and long term durability, all without breaking the bank.

POLYXBREAKER- The polyester fibers overlap during manufacturing, yielding a very dense fabric and minimal space in-between threads, making the PolyX highly resistant to any foreign body without reducing the rolling resistance.
DURASKIN- Sidewall protection coming from the high quality polyamide fabric encasing the core casing of the tire from scuffs and cuts under the worst conditions.

HARDSHELL- Hardshell protection is comprised of three main components, a deep casing overlap providing added sidewall protection, and extra wide PolyX breaker protecting the entire tread strip and finally, the casing is sheltered by a bead to bead layer of DuraSkin fabric.
HANDMADE IN GERMANY-Continental has been hand making their tires since 1871, maintaining the integrity of tradition, while evolving with the most advanced technology.
